results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2009)
results.brief_description: Seven members of the general public participate in ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. Through the life changing events and tributes to family members, resonates a search for identity and a sense of home.
results.description: Seven members of the general public participate in ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. Through the life changing events and tributes to family members, resonates a search for identity and a sense of home.

results.title: May's story
results.creator_credit: Sue Freeth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1895, at the age of 24, May sailed to Japan and dedicated her life to caring for the children in the villages. Sue Freeth, with the help of some of May’s ex-students, traces the path walked by May, and in doing so comes closer to understanding the life of this amazing woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Freeth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1895, at the age of 24, May sailed to Japan and dedicated her life to caring for the children in the villages. Sue Freeth, with the help of some of May’s ex-students, traces the path walked by May, and in doing so comes closer to understanding the life of this amazing woman.

results.title: Exports flow through Fremantle
results.creator_credit: Les Bambury, Fremantle Port Authority and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the export activity of the Port of Fremantle, with the work of all stages of production and processing of grain, fruit, wool and crayfish representing the primary industries of the state.

results.title: Expand my boundaries
results.creator_credit: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When she was given the opportunity to study in Melbourne, Denise VanWyk and her family seized it with both hands. She marvels at her new home, its diversity, acceptance and relaxed atmosphere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Bus people
results.creator_credit: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When you’re poor, there’s nothing as important as finding food. Nicole Bloom movingly recalls her distressing time on the streets, amongst the poor people of Melbourne, when riding on the bus is a luxury.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Exploring our solar system
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This video explores the Milky Way from the center to its outer limits using computer enhanced footage from NASA and specially commissioned animation based on information obtained during Voyager 2’s flyby of Neptune in 1989. Beginning with the Sun, each of the main features of the planets is described, including the earth and our moon. A description of the ways in which the solar system is investigated, including telescopes and manned and unmanned space travel is also included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

A description of the ways in which the solar system is investigated, including telescopes and manned and unmanned space travel is also included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. results.title: Exploring the heart and mind
results.creator_credit: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program discusses the Expressionist and Surrealist artists who sought to reveal deep feelings and subconscious thoughts in their painting. It includes work by Rousseau, Redon, Rouault, Matisse, Nolde, Kirchner, Kandinski and others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities

results.title: Exploring occupational health and safety
results.brief_description: Trainers and occupational health and safety managers will welcome this training package for employees which has been made in Australia expressly for Australasian conditions. Aimed particularly at the induction level employee, it is equally useful as a general refresher program or as an educational introduction to occupational health and safety. Hosted by Margaret Throsby, the issues covered by the program include management and employee responsibilities under the new legislation; the role of the National Occupational Health and Safety Commission; factors contributing to major health and safety problems such as RSI; functions of safety committees, quality circles and industrial democracy; and legal safety standards.

results.title: Explorations: wrestling
results.creator_credit: Claude Fournier, Claude Jutra, Marcel Carriere, Michel Brault, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A candid-camera view of professional wrestling as seen in the Montreal Forum, where some of the biggest bouts are staged, and in back-street wrestling parlors where the warriors practice their art. Nothing escapes the probing camera as well-muscled tyros grapple, punch, squirm, roar and grimace, adding their own variations of showmanship to amuse and excite the crowd.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Fournier, Claude Jutra, Marcel Carriere, Michel Brault, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
